definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: There can be no gainsaying of the fact that racial injustice engulfs this community.
sentences.chinese: 無可置疑的事實是，種族不公平籠罩着該市黑人社區。

sentences.english: There is little question that religion meddles in politics.
sentences.chinese: 宗教干預政治是無可置疑的。

sentences.english: Yet even where the evidence is presented impeccably, ignoring the base-rate effect can lead to miscarriages of justice.
sentences.chinese: 即使證據顯得無可置疑，忽略基礎概率也會導致誤判。

sentences.english: There’s no doubt, that gratitude and appreciation will significantly increase your chances of experiencing happiness.
sentences.chinese: 無可置疑，感恩之心會帶給你更多感受快樂的機會。

sentences.english: The growth of the whole market is indubitable as expectancy.
sentences.chinese: 整個市場的成長不如預期是無可置疑的。

sentences.english: There was no gainsaying the value of this.
sentences.chinese: 這件事的重要性是無可置疑的。

sentences.english: The growth of the whole market is not indubitable as expectancy.
sentences.chinese: 整個市場的成長不如預期是無可置疑的。
